info.description:
Welcome to the CloudQuery API documentation! This API can be used to interact with the CloudQuery platform. The API allows you to manage your teams, usage, spend limits, plugins, addons, cloud syncs, and much more.

The API is secured using bearer tokens. To get started, you can generate an API key from the CloudQuery dashboard. For a step-by-step guide, see: https://docs.cloudquery.io/docs/deployment/generate-api-key.

The base URL for the API is `https://api.cloudquery.io`.
info.title: CloudQuery OpenAPI Spec

schema.description: A list of metrics to include in the response. Each metric must be one of the predefined valid values. If not provided, only `paid-rows` will be included.
A valid ISO-8601-formatted date and time, indicating the inclusive start of the query time range. Defaults to 30 days ago.
A valid ISO-8601-formatted date and time, indicating the exclusive end of the query time range. Defaults to the current time.

parameters.description: An aggregation period to sum data over. In other words, data will be returned at this granularity. Currently only supports day and month.
parameters.name: aggregation_period

schema.description: Group by usage summary. `plugin` and `price_category` groupings are only available for `paid-rows`.

A valid ISO-8601-formatted date and time, indicating the inclusive start of the query time range. Defaults to 30 days ago.
A valid ISO-8601-formatted date and time, indicating the exclusive end of the query time range. Defaults to the current time.

PluginReleaseStage.description:
Official plugins can go through three release stages: Coming Soon, Preview, and GA.
The Coming Soon stage is for plugins that are not yet ready for Preview, but users can subscribe to be notified when they are ready.
Both Preview and GA plugins follow semantic versioning. The main differences between the two stages are:
Preview plugins are still experimental and may have frequent breaking changes. Preview plugins might get deprecated due to lack of usage. Long Term Support with community Discord and bug fixes is only guaranteed for GA plugins. Premium plugins are often discounted or free during the Preview stage.

PluginTier.description:
This field is deprecated, refer to `price_category` instead.
This field is only kept for backward compatibility and may be removed in a future release.
Supported tiers for plugins.
  - free: Free tier, with no paid tables.
  - paid: Paid tier. These plugins may have paid tables, but can also have free tables. They require login to access.
  - open-core: This option is deprecated, values will either be free or paid.

official.description: True if the plugin is maintained by CloudQuery, false otherwise

short_description.example: Sync data from AWS to any destination

public.description: Whether the plugin is listed in the CloudQuery Hub. If false, the plugin will not be shown in the CloudQuery Hub and will only be visible to members of the plugin's team.

minimum_cloud_version.description: Minimum plugin version that is supported in CloudQuery managed syncs.

VersionName.description: The version in semantic version format.

PluginReleaseStageCreate.description:
Official plugins can go through three release stages: Coming Soon, Preview, and GA.
The Coming Soon stage is for plugins that are not yet ready for Preview, but users can subscribe to be notified when they are ready.
Both Preview and GA plugins follow semantic versioning. The main differences between the two stages are:
Preview plugins are still experimental and may have frequent breaking changes. Preview plugins might get deprecated due to lack of usage. Long Term Support with community Discord and bug fixes is only guaranteed for GA plugins. Premium plugins are often discounted or free during the Preview stage.

PluginReleaseStageUpdate.description:
Official plugins can go through three release stages: Coming Soon, Preview, and GA.
The Coming Soon stage is for plugins that are not yet ready for Preview, but users can subscribe to be notified when they are ready.
Both Preview and GA plugins follow semantic versioning. The main differences between the two stages are:
Preview plugins are still experimental and may have frequent breaking changes. Preview plugins might get deprecated due to lack of usage. Long Term Support with community Discord and bug fixes is only guaranteed for GA plugins. Premium plugins are often discounted or free during the Preview stage.

message.description: Description of what's new or changed in this version (supports markdown)
message.example: - Added support for AWS S3 - Added support for AWS EC2

draft.description: If a plugin version is in draft, it will not show to members outside the team or be counted as the latest version.

retracted.description: If a plugin version is retracted, assets will still be available for download, but the version will be marked as retracted to discourage use.

supported_targets.description: The targets supported by this plugin version, formatted as <os>_<arch>

checksums.description: The checksums of the plugin assets

connector_types.description: List of connector types available for this plugin version

example_config.description: Example configuration for the plugin. This can be used in generated quickstart guides, for example. Markdown format.

ui_base_url.description: Base URL for the plugin's UI. Only available for plugins with a UI and for logged in users.

message.example: - Added support for *AWS S3* - Added support for *AWS EC2*

draft.description: If a plugin version is in draft, it will not show to members outside the team or be counted as the latest version. Once draft is set to false, only certain fields can be updated.

retracted.description: If a plugin version is retracted, assets will still be available for download, but the version will be marked as retracted to discourage use.

package_type.description: The package type of the plugin binaries

amount_due.description: Amount due in cents. This is the amount that will be charged, unless there are pending invoice items. If the invoices total is smaller than the minimum charge amount, for example, or if there is account credit that can be applied to the invoice, the amount_due may be 0. The charge that gets generated for the invoice will be for the amount specified in amount_due.

invoice_pdf.description: The link to download the PDF for the invoice.

paid.description: Whether or not payment was successfully collected for this invoice.

UsageCurrent.description: The usage of a plugin within the current calendar month.

rows.description: The number of rows used by the plugin in the calendar month.

usd.description: The USD amount used by the plugin in the calendar month, rounded to two decimal places.

remaining_usd.description: The remaining USD amount in the plugin's quota for the calendar month.

remaining_rows.description: Deprecated - this field used to contain the estimated remaining rows but now returns 1 to indicate rows are remaining or 0 if there are no more remaining rows.

UsageCurrent.title: CloudQuery Plugin Usage

UsageIncrease.description: Increase the usage of a plugin. This can incur billing costs and should be used only by plugins.

rows.description: The total number of additional rows used by the plugin.

request_id.description: A unique ID associated with the usage increase.

UsageIncrease.title: CloudQuery Plugin Usage Increase

value.description: The value of the group at this index.

timestamp.description: The timestamp marking the start of a period.

paid_rows.description: The paid rows that were synced in this period, one per group.

cloud_vcpu_seconds.description: vCPU/seconds consumed in this period, one per group.

cloud_vram_byte_seconds.description: vRAM/byte-seconds consumed in this period, one per group.

cloud_egress_bytes.description: Egress bytes consumed in this period, one per group.

UsageSummary.description:
A usage summary for a team, summarizing the paid rows synced and/or cloud resource usage over a given time range.
Note that empty or all-zero values are not included in the response.

groups.description: The groups of the usage summary. Every group will have a corresponding value at the same index in the values array.

UsageSummary.title: CloudQuery Usage Summary

PriceCategorySpend.description: Spend by price category for a defined period.
PriceCategorySpend.title: Spend by price category

date.description: The timestamp for the spend summary.

total.description: Total spend for the period in USD.

SpendSummary.description:
A spend summary for a team, summarizing the spend by each price category over a given time range.
Note that empty or all-zero values are not included in the response.
SpendSummary.title: CloudQuery Spend Summary

ManagedDatabaseStatus.description: The status of the managed database

created_at.description: Time the managed database was created

connection_string.description: The connection string to the database

expiration.description: Time the managed database should expire

ConnectorAuthRequestAWS.description: AWS connector authentication request to start the authentication process

plugin_team.description: Team that owns the plugin we are authenticating the connector for

account_ids.description: List of AWS account IDs to authenticate

ConnectorAuthResponseAWS.description: AWS connector authentication response to start the authentication process

redirect_url.description: URL to redirect the user to, to authenticate

role_template_url.description: URL to the role template, to present to the user

suggested_external_id.description: External ID suggested to enter into the role definition

suggested_policy_arns.description: List of AWS policy ARNs suggested to grant inside the role definition

ConnectorAuthFinishRequestAWS.description: AWS connector authentication request, filled in after the user has authenticated through AWS

role_arn.description: ARN of role created by the user

external_id.description: External ID in the role definition. Optional. If not provided the previously suggested external ID will be used. Empty string will remove the external ID.

ConnectorAuthRequestOAuth.description: OAuth connector authentication request to start the authentication process

plugin_team.description: Team that owns the plugin we are authenticating the connector for

base_url.description: Base of the URL the callback url will be constructed from

spec.format: Plugin parameters, specific to each plugin

env.description: Environment variables used in the spec.

ConnectorAuthResponseOAuth.description: OAuth connector authentication response to start the authentication process

redirect_url.description: URL to redirect the user to, to authenticate

ConnectorAuthFinishRequestOAuth.description: OAuth connector authentication request, filled in after the user has authenticated through OAuth

auth_code.description: Auth code received from the OAuth provider

base_url.description: Base of the URL the callback url was constructed from

state.description: State value received from the OAuth provider

spec.format: Plugin parameters, specific to each plugin

env.description: Environment variables used in the spec.

example.name: aws
example.short_description: Sync data from AWS to any destination

message.description:
A message describing what's new or changed in this version.
This message will be displayed to users in the plugin's changelog.
Supports limited markdown syntax.

supported_targets.description: The targets supported by this plugin version, formatted as <os>_<arch>

checksums.description: List of SHA-256 checksums for this plugin version, one for each supported target.

example.name: aws-policies
example.short_description: Sync data from AWS to any destination

message.description:
A message describing what's new or changed in this version.
This message will be displayed to users in the addon's changelog.
Supports limited markdown syntax.

plugin_deps.description: plugin dependencies in the format of ['team_name/kind/plugin_name@version']

addon_deps.description: addon dependencies in the format of ['team_name/type/addon_name@version']

checksum.description: SHA-256 checksum for the addon asset

example.name: aws-source
example.short_description: Sync data from AWS to any destination

rows.description: Number of rows synced so far

warnings.description: Number of warnings encountered so far

errors.description: Number of errors encountered so far

location.description: The location to download the sync run logs from

rows.description: The additional rows used by the table.

UsageSummary_metadata.description: Additional metadata about the usage summary. This may include information about the time range, the aggregation period, or other details.

start.description: The inclusive start of the query time range.

end.description: The exclusive end of the query time range.

aggregation_period.description: The aggregation period to sum data over. In other words, data will be returned at this granularity.

metrics.description: List of metrics included in the response.

SpendSummary_metadata.description: Additional metadata about the spend summary. This may include information about the time range, the aggregation period, or other details.

start.description: The inclusive start of the query time range.

end.description: The exclusive end of the query time range.
